title: How to figure out a rectangle’s sides’ length if I only know the length of the diagonal and the perimeter - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi!!! Let us assume that there is a rectangle having a diagonal as 5 cm and perimeter as 14 cm (This is just an example. However, this framework can be used for solving such type of questions)  Perimeter = 2(x+y)=142(x+y)=14 x+y=7x+y=7 —(i) Squaring both sides, x2+y2+2xy=49x2+y2+2xy=49—(ii) Also, by Pythagoras theorem, x2+y2=25x2+y2=25 —(iii) Substituting eq (iii) in eq (ii) 2xy=49−25=242xy=49−25=24 xy=12xy=12—(iv) x+7/x=12sincey=7/xfromequation(iv)x+7/x=12sincey=7/xfromequation(iv) Thus, x2+7=12xx2+7=12x x2−12x+7=0x2−12x+7=0 Solving this equation we get x=4 or x=3 When x=4, y =3 Also, when x=3, y=4 So, the sides of the rectangle are 4cm,3cm or 3cm,4cm. Pls upvote!! Cheers!!!

Half the perimeter gives the sum of two sides…let s say 7cm.Then if one side is X cm the other is 7-X . Then use Pythagoras. Let s say the diagonal is 5cm. Then 5*2 = X*2+(7-X)*2. Then solve the quadratic equation. In this case X is 3cm so the sides are 3and 4cm long
Digonal = D sides a and b Perimeter P P= 2(a+b) D^2 = a^2+b^2 P^2=4(a^2+b^2+2ab) P^2 = 4 (D^2 +2ab) (P^2-4D^2)/8 =ab We now know values of a and b from a+b and ab in terms of P and D.
